tutorials.title: Set Up TallyPrime for Payments and Receipts Through Bank
tutorials.learning:
Last updated on: October 8, 2025 \| ⏱ 17 min read

A one-time setup in TallyPrime helps you record payments and receipts through a bank. TallyPrime provides you with the facility to have all your and your parties’ bank accounts, as a part of your Company data. This allows you to record payments and receipts through Bank along with the necessary bank details, such as account number and mode of transaction like cheque, DD, or e-Payments, as needed.

If you are using the Connected Banking feature in TallyPrime, then you will need a quick setup to log in to Connected Banking and connect your bank accounts to TallyPrime.

## [Maintain Your Bank Account Details \| Create/Alter Bank Ledgers](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/\#create-bank-ledgers)

While you can update the bank details during ledger creation, you can alter the ledger any time in case any updates are required.

[![](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/watch-video.png)](https://youtu.be/5rOnK_4x5c8)

1. Create the **Bank** **Ledger**.

1. Press **Alt+G**(Go To) > **Create Master** \> type or select **Ledger** \> and press **Enter**.

      Alternatively, **Gateway of Tally** > **Create** > type or select **Ledger** \> and press **Enter**.
2. Enter the **Name** of the bank for the bank ledger.
3. Select **Bank Accounts** from the **List of Groups**, in the **Under** if you are creating the Bank Ledger for Savings/Current account.
2. Update **Bank Account Details**.

1. **A/c Holder’s Name**: It prefills the company name; however, you can alter this name by pressing **Backspace**.
2. **A/c No.**: Provide the account number of your bank.
3. **IFS Code**: Provide the IFS code for your bank.

      An IFS code follows a unique format prescribed by each bank. Therefore, you will need to enter the code in that specific format. If not, you will be prompted with a warning message, with the correct format of the code.
4. **SWIFT Code**: Applicable for international bank payments.
5. **Bank Name**: Select the bank name from the List of Banks.

      The List of Banks is displayed only when TSS and internet connectivity are available. Additionally, the bank configurations depend on the bank you select.

6. **Branch**: Provide the Branch name of the bank.
7. **BSR Code**: Provide the BSR code for your bank.

      ```
      BSR code is applicable for bank transactions related to TDS. Therefore, you will see this option only if you have enabled TDS for your company in Company Features.
      ```

8. **Client Code**: This is a unique code given by the bank to their customer as an identifier.

      ```
      Client Code will be displayed only when Bank Name is selected as Kotak Mahindra Bank (India), Bank of Baroda (India) or Yes Bank and its a mandatory field in payment instruction file.
      In case of Yes Bank this is mandatory field in payment instruction file in Delimited (|) format.
      ```
3. Update **Bank Configuration** if you want to change the configuration for cheque printing. To know more, click [here](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-cheque-printing-tally/#setup-cheque-printing).
1. **Set/Alter Bank configuration**: **Yes**.

      If you are using TallyPrime Release 5.1 or earlier, then this step is not required.
2. **Set/Alter range for Cheque Books**: If you want to set the range for chequebooks for one or more cheque books you can enable this option.
3. **Enable Cheque Printing**: You can print the cheques issued for the payment to your party once you enable this option.
4. **Set/Alter Cheque Printing configuration**: This option once enabled allows you to configure the cheque format depending on which bank the cheques belong to.
4. Provide other details as required.

[![bank-ledger-creation](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bank-Ledger-Creation.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bank-Ledger-Creation.jpg)
5. Accept the ledger screen. As always, press **Ctrl+A** to save.

After you create the Bank ledger, you can record the bank transactions. You can further [configure the Bank Ledger](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/#configure-bank-ledgers) to include more options if required.

### [Configure Bank Ledgers for Business Needs](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/\#configure-bank-ledgers)

#### [Tracking of payments and receipts from various cost centres](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/\#configure-bank-ledger-cost-centre)

While making a payment, you can allocate amounts to specific cost centres for tracking. Enable the Cost Centre feature and configure the Bank Ledger to enable Cost Centres, if not already done.

1. Enable the Cost Centre feature.

   - Press **F11** (Features) > set **Enable Cost Centres** to **Yes**.
2. Enable Cost Centres for Ledger.

1.  In the **Ledger Creation**/ **Alteration** screen for Bank Ledger, press **F12** (Configure).
2. Enable **Apply Cost Centres for Ledgers**.
3. Press **Ctrl+A** to accept the configuration.
3. As always, press **Ctrl+A** to accept the screen.

If you need to apply a cost centre for one specific ledger, press **Ctrl** + **I** (More Details) > set **Cost centre applicability** to **Yes**.

After you enable the cost centre feature for your bank ledger, you can allocate the payments and receipts to the respective cost centres and track them.

#### [Configure Bank Reconciliation](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/\#bank-recon)

TallyPrime provides a wide range of configurations for reconciliation, be it opening BRS or reconciliation using the imported bank statement.

##### [Set Reconciliation Beginning date](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/\#recon-beginning-date)

In the **Ledger Creation/Alteration** screen, you can specify a date from which you want to start reconciling your transactions.

- **Set/Alter Bank configuration**: **Yes**.
- **Reconciliation Beginning date**: Enter the date.

Reconciliation will be applicable from the date specified here.

#### [Set/Alter Opening BRS](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/\#opening-brs)

In the **Ledger Creation/Alteration** screen, you can view transactions that are a part of your opening BRS. Moreover, while altering a ledger, you can add a transaction to the opening BRS, or even alter a transaction that is a part of the opening BRS.

1. **Set/Alter Bank configuration**: **Yes**.
2. **Set/Alter Opening BRS**: **Yes**.

This option is available only during ledger alteration.
3. Press **Alt+L** (Update Opening BRS).

[![opening-brs](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/1-set-opening-brs-tallyprime-1024x493.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/1-set-opening-brs-tallyprime.jpg)
4. Enter the details of the transaction.

1. **Date**: Enter the date of transaction.

      This date should be before the Reconciliation Beginning date.
2. **Particulars**: Enter the ledger name.
3. **Nature of Transaction**: Select Deposit or Withdrawal, as applicable.
4. **Transaction Type**: Select from the list of transaction types.
5. **Remarks**: Enter the remark, if needed.
6. **Deposit/Withdrawal**: Enter the Amount.
7. **Instrument No.**: Enter the Instrument No., as applicable.
8. **Instrument Date**: By default, this is prefilled, based on the entered Date.

      [![entering-opening-brs](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/2-entering-opening-brs-tallyprime.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/2-entering-opening-brs-tallyprime.jpg)
5. Press **Ctrl+A** to save the configuration.

##### [Auto-reconciliation of transactions](https://help.tallysolutions.com/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/\#auto-reconciliation)

If you create vouchers from bank statement, then you can specify the default voucher types and voucher numbering series for deposits and withdrawals.

What’s more, you can choose to find exact matches to your book transaction at the time of importing the statement and even saving the voucher.

You can do so in the **Ledger Creation/Alteration** screen.

01. **Set/Alter Bank configuration**: **Yes**.
02. In the **Bank Configuration** screen, **set/Alter Auto Reconciliation configuration**: **Yes**.
03. **Deposits**: **Receipt**.
04. **Withdrawals**: **Payment**.
05. **Voucher numbering series**: Specify the voucher number series that should be used for recording payment transactions, if needed.

    To know more, refer to [Voucher Numbering](https://help.tallysolutions.com/knowledgebase/voucher-types-tally/#voucher-numbering).
06. **Use a different Voucher Type for Interbank/Cash transactions**: **Yes**, if you want to use the Contra or Journal voucher type for such transactions.
07. **Interbank/Cash Transactions**: Contra or Journal as applicable.
08. **Identify Exact Matches for Reconciliation**:

    - **While Importing statement**: **Yes**.

      TallyPrime identifies a voucher in the Books, which exactly matches the transaction in the Bank Statement, at the time of import.
    - **While Importing statement as well as Saving Voucher**: **Yes**.

      TallyPrime also identifies a transaction in the bank statement that exactly matches the voucher when you save it.
09. **Automatically Reconcile Exact Matches found**: **Yes**.

    [![auto-reconciliation](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/3-auto-reconciliation-tallyprime.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/3-auto-reconciliation-tallyprime.jpg)

    Henceforth, if there are any exact matches found while importing statements and saving vouchers, then they will get automatically reconciled with the transactions available in the books.
10. Press **Ctrl+A** to save the configuration.

#### [Configurations for e-Payments](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/\#e-payments)

In the **Ledger Creation/Alteration** screen, you can easily set up e-Payments for selected banks. Moreover, you can configure the amounts for e-Fund transfer. Note that e-Payments can only be set up for selected banks. Moreover, you can configure amounts for e-Fund transfer.

##### [Configure Transfer Mode details for e-Fund transfer](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/\#e-fund-transfer)

1. **Set/Alter Bank configuration**: **Yes**.
2. In the **Bank Configuration** screen, **set/Alter Transfer Mode details for e-Fund Transfer**: **Yes**
3. Enter the **From** and **To** amounts against each mode.

Based on the entered amounts, the transfer mode will get applicable when you record e-Payments.
4. **Preferred Mode**: Select the preferred transfer mode.

This option is useful in case of overlap in the From and To amounts entered against the transfer modes.

So, when more than one transfer modes are applicable to a specific amount, then the preferred transfer mode gets selected.

[![e-fund-transfer](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/4-e-fund-transfer-mode-ledger-alteration-tallyprime.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/4-e-fund-transfer-mode-ledger-alteration-tallyprime.jpg)
5. Press **Ctrl+A** to save the configuration.

##### [Bank-specific configurations for e-Payments](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/\#e-payments-config)

In the **Ledger Creation/Alteration** screen, you can set e-Payments configuration for specific banks. These configurations are based on the payment instructions required by the bank to process e-Payments.

1. **Set/Alter Bank configuration**: **Yes**.
2. In the **Bank Configuration** screen, **Enable e-Payments**: **Yes**

The configurations are applicable based on the bank that you select under **Bank Name**.

[![e-Payments Configuration](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/6-e-payments-confguration.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/6-e-payments-confguration.jpg)
3. Update the configuration, as required.

1. Export/Upload Payment Instructions on voucher creation: Yes.

      You will be able to export the Payment Instructions when you save the voucher.
2. Allow export of transactions with mismatch in Bank Details: Yes.

      Even if there is a mismatch in the Bank Details such as Account No. and IFSC compared to details in the master, you will be able to export the Payment Instruction.
3. Update other configurations, based on the bank, as needed.
4. Press **Ctrl+A** to save.

#### [Record Receipts with uncertain bank details \| Notional Bank](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/\#configure-bank-ledgers-notional-bank)

Notional Bank has the same features as a normal bank account. You can create a Notional bank when you are unable to decide the bank in which the post-dated cheques are to be deposited. Later you can manually convert the post-dated cheques received to regular receipts and move to regular banks.

To know more, refer to [Receipts with uncertain bank details](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/#configure-bank-ledgers-notional-bank).

If you’re using TallyPrime Release 5.1 or earlier versions, then click here

## [Configure Bank Ledgers](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/\#configure-bank-ledgers)

When you make payments through cheques or online payments irrespective of the payment mode, you can configure your Bank ledger for both cheques and e-payments. However, you can also choose to create separate Bank ledgers based on the payment mode if you wish to maintain the bank ledger separately for easy tracking. To perform the reconciliation of your Bank statements, you can configure your Bank ledger accordingly and provide the effective date of the reconciliation. E-payments and Bank reconciliation are only available for those banks that TallyPrime supports.

If you are not sure where to deposit your post-dated cheques, you can create bank ledgers as Notional Bank and record the initial entry in the Notional Bank ledger. Later once you are sure where to deposit your cheque you can record the entry to the respective bank account. Apart from these, you can configure your bank ledger to apply cost centres and allocate all the expenses to the respective cost centres and you can view the same in the report.

You can perform all these configurations while creating the Bank ledger. You can also alter the ledger later and configure your ledger as per your business needs.

_In this section_:

- [Configure bank ledgers for Cost Centres](https://help.tallysolutions.com/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/#configure-bank-ledger-cost-centre)
- [Configure bank ledgers for Auto Reconciliation](https://help.tallysolutions.com/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/#configure-bank-ledger-auto-recon)
- [Configure bank ledgers for e-Payments](https://help.tallysolutions.com/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/#configure-bank-ledgers-e-payments)
- [Configure bank ledgers as Notional Bank](https://help.tallysolutions.com/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/#configure-bank-ledgers-notional-bank)

### [Configure bank ledgers for Cost Centres](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/\#configure-bank-ledger-cost-centre)

While making the payment, you may want to allocate the amount to specific cost centres for tracking the payments and receipts. In such a case, you can enable the Cost Centre feature for your company and configure the Bank Ledger to apply Cost Centres if it is not enabled earlier.

[![](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/watch-video.png)](https://youtu.be/vPBfQUr2f08)

1. Enable the Cost Centre feature if not already enabled.

   - Press **F11** (Features) > set **Enable Cost Centres** to **Yes**.
2. Enable Cost Centres for Ledger.

1.  In the **Ledger Creation**/ **Alteration** screen for Bank Ledger, press **F12** (Configure).
2. Enable **Apply Cost Centres for Ledgers.**
3. Press **Ctrl+A** to accept the screen.
3. As always, press **Ctrl+A** to accept the screen.

If you need to apply a cost centre for one specific ledger, you can apply a cost centre through **Ctrl** + **I** (More Details) > set **Cost centre applicability** to **Yes**.

After you enable the cost centre feature for your bank ledger, you can allocate the payments and receipts to respective cost centres and track the same.

### [Configure bank ledgers for Auto Reconciliation](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/\#configure-bank-ledger-auto-recon)

You can configure your bank ledgers with auto reconciliation to perform your bank reconciliation without any error and hassle. This requires you to download the bank statement and import the same to perform the reconciliation.

To know more, refer to [Configure bank ledger to perform auto reconciliation](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/bank-reconciliation-tally/#configure-bank-ledger-auto-recon).

### [Configure bank ledgers for e-Payments](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/\#configure-bank-ledgers-e-payments)

If you are making payments to parties through an e-fund transfer then in TallyPrime you can configure the Bank Ledger with e-Payments. You can configure your Bank ledger for e-payments only for selected banks. The options that you can configure will also depend on the bank in which you have enabled the e-Payments facility. You can also activate a bulk upload/payment facility, for which you need to reach out to your Bank Relationship Manager. In TallyPrime, you can view the contact details.

To know more, refer to [Configure bank ledger for e-Payments](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/e-payments-tally/#configure-e-payments).

### [Configure bank ledgers as Notional Bank](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/\#configure-bank-ledgers-notional-bank)

Notional Bank has the same features as a normal bank account. You can create a Notional bank when you are unable to decide the bank in which the post-dated cheques are to be deposited. Later you can manually convert the post-dated cheques received to regular receipts and move to regular banks.

To know more, refer to [Configure Bank Ledger to Record Receipts for Uncertain Banks](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/post-dated-cheque-managment-tally/#notional-bank)

## [Configure Party Ledgers](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/\#configure-party-ledgers)

You can make payments to your party through cash, cheque or online transfer. If you want to pay your party through an e-fund transfer, you need to update the party ledger with their bank details. You can update the bank details at the time of creating the party ledger or even at a later point by altering the party ledger. You can add multiple bank details for a party to the ledger. In TallyPrime, you can add the bank details or import from MS Excel in bulk. This helps in generating the payment instructions in the format supported by the respective banks.

[![](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/watch-video.png)](https://youtu.be/3GDYlqte1sg)

1. Open the **Ledger Creation/Alteration** screen to create or alter the party ledger.

1. Press **Alt+G**(Go To) > **Create/Alter Master** \> type or select **Ledger** \> and press **Enter**.

      Alternatively, **Gateway of Tally** > **Create/Alter** > type or select **Ledger** \> and press **Enter**.
2. Enter the **Name** of the Party and create it under **Sundry Creditors**.
3. Provide other details such as **Mailing Details**.
2. Update Banking Details.

1. Under **Banking Details**, enable **Provide bank details**. The Bank Details screen appears.
2. In the **Bank Details** > **Transaction Type** screen, select **e-Fund Transfer** and provide the necessary details:

      - **A/c No**: Valid account number of the party.
      - **IFS Code** of the party’s bank.
      - **Bank Name** from the List of Banks
      - **Set as default**: Enable this option to set the bank as a default option.

        Depending on the transaction type or the bank you select, the fields change accordingly.

        [![Bank-details-for-party](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bank-details-for-party.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bank-details-for-party.jpg)
3. Press **Ctrl+A** to accept the screen.
3. As always, press **Ctrl+A** to save the ledger creation screen.

To add multiple bank details manually to a party ledger, press **F12** (Configure) > enable **Allow multiple beneficiary details**.

You can [import](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/#import-beneficiary-details-in-bulk) bank details in bulk for your party from MS Excel which reduces the time and effort to update the details manually.

## [Import Bank Statements](https://help.tallysolutions.com/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/\#import-bank-statements)

You might need to import Bank Details for reconciliation with your payment records. Before importing the Bank Statements, you can configure their data paths without having to choose the path every time you need to import the bank statements.

- Folder Path for new Bank Statements
- Folder Path for imported Bank Statements
- Folder Path for new Intermediate Files
- Folder Path for imported Intermediate Files

Once you have configured the data paths, you can import the Bank Details into TallyPrime.

1. Press **Alt+O** (Import) > select **Bank Details**.
2. Enter the **File Path** and **File to Import** details.

![](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/import-bank-statement.jpg)

On successful import, the TallyPrime displays a success message with the details of import.

For more information on importing bank details and bank reconciliation, refer to the [Bank Reconciliation](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/bank-reconciliation-tally/) topic.

## **[Import of Beneficiary Details in Bulk](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/\#import-beneficiary-details-in-bulk)**

The feature to import in bulk in TallyPrime provides you with a great experience with banking, especially for e-payments. You can save the required bank details of your vendors or employees in one place, and easily import them to TallyPrime as a one-time activity.

_In this section_

- [Update beneficiary details in MS Excel](https://help.tallysolutions.com/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/#update-beneficiary-details)
- [Import beneficiary details to TallyPrime](https://help.tallysolutions.com/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/#import-beneficiary-details)

### [Update beneficiary details in MS Excel](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/\#update-beneficiary-details)

TallyPrime provides you with a sample MS Excel with the columns required to update the details of the beneficiaries. You can download the sample file from the import menu and update the details in .xlsx format.

[![](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/watch-video.png)](https://youtu.be/4dO4pP1Ld68)

1. Press **Alt+O**(Import) > **Bank Details**.
2. Press **Alt+B**(Payee Sample file), if you want to download the Payee Sample file. Alternatively, if you want to download the Employee Sample file, then press **Alt+H**(Emp. Sample file).

The **Exporting Sample File** screen appears:

[![Export sample file for bulk upload](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Export-sample-file-for-bulk-upload.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Export-sample-file-for-bulk-upload.jpg)
3. Press **E** (Send) to save the sample file in your desired folder. If you want to change the folder path or other settings, then press **C** (Configure) before saving the file.

The sample file will open.
4. Enter the details of your beneficiaries and ensure that the Ledger Name in the Excel sheet matches the name of the ledger in TallyPrime.

A filled-in Payee Sample file will appear as shown below. You can add multiple bank details of the same party and provide Ref ID for each account detail.

[![Payee Sample file](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Payee-Sample-file.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Payee-Sample-file.jpg)

### [Import beneficiary details to TallyPrime](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/\#import-beneficiary-details)

Once the MS Excel file is ready with the beneficiary details, you can import it to TallyPrime.

[![](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/watch-video.png)](https://youtu.be/EBIfyXSNhAc)

1. Press **Alt+O**(Import)> **Bank Details**. The **Import Bank Details** screen opens.
2. Specify the **File path** and the **File to Import (Excel)**.

[![Import Bank details](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Import-Bank-details.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Import-Bank-details.jpg)
3. Press **Enter** to import the beneficiary details. The following success message will appear after import:

[![Success message](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Success-message.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Success-message.jpg)

You can open the respective party/employee ledger if you want to verify the details:

1. Press **A** **lt+** **G** (Go To) > **Alter Master** > type or select **Ledger** > press **Enter**.

Alternatively, **Gateway of Tally** > **Alter** > type or select **Ledger** > press **Enter**.
2. Set the option **Provide bank details** to **Yes**.

The following screen appears:

[![Bank details for party after bulk import](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bank-details-for-party-after-bulk-import.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bank-details-for-party-after-bulk-import.jpg)

After the import of details in bulk, all the bank details maintained in Excel are updated in the party ledger. You can manually verify if the details are updated correctly.

## Allow or Restrict Users from Performing Bank-Related Tasks \| Security Controls

You can allow or restrict users from performing specific tasks related to banking.

### [Security for e-Payments](https://help.tallysolutions.com/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/\#security-e-payments)

You can provide additional security for your banking details and e-payments by creating users with special rights and authorising them for specific operations. You can use the **Security Control** feature to set up the required security levels. For example, if you want your data entry operator to have access only for e-Payments related reports, then you can allow full access or access to alter for the List of Reports related to e-Payments.

To know more, refer to [Security for e-Payments](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/e-payments-tally/#security-e-payments).

### [Security for Connected Banking](https://help.tallysolutions.com/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/\#security-connected-banking)

You can restrict certain users from accessing the Connected Banking facilities. For instance, you might not want a certain set of users to get the latest Bank Balance. You can restrict the users from doing so.

For instance, you may want to disallow data entry operators from viewing balance as per bank in Dashboard.

1. Press **Alt+K** (Company) > **User Roles** > **Data Entry**.
2. Under **Disallow the Following Facilities**, select **Balance as per Bank – Connected Banking (Tile)** and press **Enter**.

[![Security Setup for Connected Banking](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/5-security-for-connected-banking-tallyprime-1.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/5-security-for-connected-banking-tallyprime-1.jpg)

tutorials.title: Banking Utilities in TallyPrime
tutorials.learning:
Last updated on: November 24, 2025 \| ⏱ 4 min read

[**List of Supported Banks**](https://help.tallysolutions.com/list-of-banks-supported-by-tallyprime-for-e-payments-auto-brs-and-cheque-formats/) **\| [Banking – FAQ](https://help.tallysolutions.com/faq-banking-tally/) \| [Errors & Resolutions](https://help.tallysolutions.com/errors-and-resolution-banking-tally/)**

TallyPrime is a versatile software for recording [banking transactions](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/New-TP-6.0_Quick-Start-Guide-compressed.pdf) with the necessary Bank account details. It reduces your data entry effort with automated voucher creation from Bank Statements. An enhanced Bank Reconciliation ensures that your Book transactions are in sync with your Bank transactions.

Here’s your [Quick-Start Guide](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/TallyPrime_6.0_PrimeBanking_Quick_Start_Guide.pdf) to PrimeBanking with TallyPrime Release 6.0.

Connected Banking enhances productivity by enabling secure task completion right from TallyPrime. On the other hand, e-Payments facilitate bulk payments to suppliers in one go. You can always send invoices with payment link or QR code to [pace up the receivables in your business](https://tallysolutions.com/tally/how-businesses-use-technology-to-improve-payment-process/). You can ensure that you receive payments from your buyers faster with Payment Request.

For cheque transactions, TallyPrime supports various cheque formats and maintains detailed records.

Moreover, you can send Payment Advice for payments to your suppliers. Whenever you receive money through Cheque, DD, or cash, you can get Deposit Slips right from TallyPrime.

[![Banking in TallyPrime](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/banking-utilities-in-tallyprime.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/banking-utilities-in-tallyprime.jpg)

## [Automate Accounting Using Bank Statements](https://help.tallysolutions.com/banking/\#automated-accounting)

For the transactions that are available in the bank but not in the books, you can create vouchers without any data entry effort.

With the facility of automated voucher creation, you can create:

- Create [single voucher](https://help.tallysolutions.com/bank-reconciliation-tally/#single-vch).
- Create [multiple vouchers](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally/bank-reconciliation/#multi-vch) with a common or separate ledgers.
- [Merge multiple transactions](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally/bank-reconciliation/#consolidated-vch) to create a voucher with the consolidated amount.

The facility of automated voucher creation from Bank Statements is available for [more than 145 banks](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/list-of-banks-supported-by-tallyprime-for-e-payments-auto-brs-and-cheque-formats/#auto-bank-reconciliation).

## [Bank Reconciliation](https://help.tallysolutions.com/banking/\#bank-recon)

Once you set up TallyPrime with a [Bank Reconciliation Beginning date](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/#recon-beginning-date) and [auto-reconciliation configuration](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/#auto-reconciliation), you can ensure that your books are in sync with the bank.

TallyPrime supports Bank Reconciliation for [more than 145 banks](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/list-of-banks-supported-by-tallyprime-for-e-payments-auto-brs-and-cheque-formats/#auto-bank-reconciliation), offering the following facilities:

- [Set or alter opening BRS](https://help.tallysolutions.com/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/#opening-brs) for transactions dated prior to the Bank Reconciliation Beginning date.
- Make Bank Statements a part of your Company data securely by:

  - [Importing Bank Statement](https://help.tallysolutions.com/bank-reconciliation-tally/#import-statement) files.
  - [Getting Bank Statements](https://help.tallysolutions.com/connected-banking/#get-statement) through Connected Banking.
- Automatically reconcile book transactions:

  - With an [exact match](https://help.tallysolutions.com/bank-reconciliation-tally/#exact-match) in bank entries.
  - By finding [potential matches](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally/bank-reconciliation/#potential-match) to the book transactions.
  - By [finding a match](https://help.tallysolutions.com/bank-reconciliation-tally/#find-match).
  - With a [partial match](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally/bank-reconciliation/#partial-match).
- [Reconcile transactions manually](https://help.tallysolutions.com/bank-reconciliation-tally/#reconcile-manually).

## [Connected Banking](https://help.tallysolutions.com/banking/\#connected-banking)

You can get all the benefits of [Connected Banking](https://tallysolutions.com/connected-banking/) once you complete the following:

- [Link a mobile number to your Tally.NET ID](https://help.tallysolutions.com/connected-banking/#register).
- [Change your Tally.NET password](https://help.tallysolutions.com/connected-banking/#change-password), if needed.
- [Connect your Bank accounts](https://help.tallysolutions.com/connected-banking/#connect-to-bank).

Once you set up TallyPrime for Connected Banking, you can [log in](https://help.tallysolutions.com/connected-banking/#login) any time and do the following right from TallyPrime:

- [Get Bank Balance](https://help.tallysolutions.com/connected-banking/#get-balance).
- [Get Bank Statement](https://help.tallysolutions.com/connected-banking/#get-statement).

At any point in time, you can [reconnect](https://help.tallysolutions.com/connected-banking/#reconnect) or [disconnect](https://help.tallysolutions.com/connected-banking/#disconnect) Bank accounts from TallyPrime.

## [e-Payments](https://help.tallysolutions.com/banking/\#e-payments)

Once you [configure e-Payments](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/#e-payments) for the [applicable transfer modes](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/#e-fund-transfer) and [bank-related requirements](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/#e-payments-config), you can:

- [Record e-Payments](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/e-payments-tally/#record-e-payment-transaction) with all the necessary details.
- Make [secure bulk payments.](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/e-payments-tally/#exportupload-payment-instructions-to-the-bank)
- [Reconcile e-Payments](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-tally/#e-payment-recon) by importing the Payment Reverse File.

What’s more, TallyPrime has an [e-Payments report](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/e-payments-tally/#view-e-payments-report) that help you identify payments with different statuses.

TallyPrime supports [e-Payments for 17 banks](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/list-of-banks-supported-by-tallyprime-for-e-payments-auto-brs-and-cheque-formats/#e-payments). You can [contact your Bank](https://help.tallysolutions.com/contact-details-of-banks-for-e-payment/) to start using the of e-Payments feature in TallyPrime.

## [Payment Request](https://help.tallysolutions.com/banking/\#payment-request)

With [Payment Request](https://tallysolutions.com/accounting/digital-payment-requests-in-tallyprime-via-upi/), you can ensure that your invoices have a payment link or QR code. For your buyers, making payments to you becomes an easy task.

Firstly, you need to create a payment [merchant profile through Gateway](https://help.tallysolutions.com/payment-request/#create-merchant-profile-using-payment-gateway) or [UPI](https://help.tallysolutions.com/payment-request/#create-merchant-profile-using-upi), as needed.

Once done, you can:

- Generate payment link or QR code

  - [Using Payment Gateway](https://help.tallysolutions.com/payment-request/#generate-payment-link-in-transactions-payment-gateway) or [QR Code](https://help.tallysolutions.com/payment-request/#generate-qr-code-in-transactions-upi).
  - [After recording the transaction](https://help.tallysolutions.com/payment-request/#generate-payment-link-qr-code-after-recording-transaction).
  - For one or more transactions from [Day Book](https://help.tallysolutions.com/payment-request/#payment-link-qr-code-from-day-book) and [Ledger Vouchers/Ledger Outstanding](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/payment-request/#payment-link-qr-code-from-ledger-voucher-outstandings) s.
- [Print invoices & reports with Payment Link/QR Code](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/payment-request/#print-invoices-reports-with-payment-link-qr-code).
- [Export/e-mail invoices & reports with Payment Link/QR Code](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/payment-request/#export-e-mail-invoices-reports-with-payment-link-qr-code).
- [Track Payment Links/QR Codes](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/payment-request/#track-payment-link-qr-code) that are generated or pending to be generated.
- [Reconcile Payment Gateway transactions](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/payment-request/#reconcile-payment-gateway-transactions).

## [Cheque Payments](https://help.tallysolutions.com/banking/\#cheque-payments)

TallyPrime provides you with a range of facilities to make payments through cheques. You can:

- [Print cheque details in a payment voucher](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-cheque-printing-tally/#print-cheque-in-payment-voucher).
- [Print a cheque to withdraw cash](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-cheque-printing-tally/#print-self-cheque).
- [View cheques to be printed](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/banking-cheque-printing-tally/#cheque-printing-report).
- [Record and track post-dated cheques](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/post-dated-cheque-managment-tally/#post-dated-cheque-entry).
- [Record post-dated transactions with Notional Bank](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/post-dated-cheque-managment-tally/#post-dated-transaction-notional-bank).

You also have the flexibility to [specify cheque range and cheque format](https://help.tallysolutions.com/banking-cheque-printing-tally/#enable-cheque-range-cheque-format). Moreover, you can [use predefined cheque format](https://help.tallysolutions.com/banking-cheque-printing-tally/#Alter-predefined-cheque) and [user-defined cheque format](https://help.tallysolutions.com/banking-cheque-printing-tally/#alter-user-defined), as needed.

## [Deposit Slips for Payments Received as Cash/Cheque](https://help.tallysolutions.com/banking/\#deposit-slips)

You can generate [Deposit Slips](https://help.tallysolutions.com/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/#deposit-slips) for the cash, cheque, or DD received from the buyer that you need to deposit in your bank account.

## [Payment Advice for Payments](https://help.tallysolutions.com/banking/\#payment-advice)

You can send [Payment Advice](https://help.tallysolutions.com/banking-ledgers-deposits-payments-tally/#payment-advice) to your sellers after the money is paid through cheques, cash, or e-Payments.

tutorials.title: Use e-Payments Report to Take Actions on Your e-Payments in TallyPrime
tutorials.learning:
Last updated on: December 5, 2025 \| ⏱ 13 min read

Payments are an important aspect of business, and TallyPrime helps you stay updated about the status of all the transactions. If a transaction has all the necessary details and is ready for sending to bank, then you will want to export it from TallyPrime. If a transaction is not ready for sending to bank, then you will want to know about the changes required in the transaction, so that you can take actions and make it ready for export. The e-Payments report provides helps you know the status of transactions.

- To view the e-Payments report, press **Alt+G** (Go To) > type or select **Banking Activities**, press **Enter**,and then drill down from the e-Payments column for a specific Bank ledger.

[![e-Payments Report in TallyPrime](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/1-e-payments-report-tallyprime.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/1-e-payments-report-tallyprime.jpg)

You get to know the **Count** and **Amount** of transactions under specific sections, based on the status of the transactions.

#### [View Balance as per Bank Statement for Connected Bank Ledgers](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/\#balance-as-per-statement)

If you are using the Connected Banking and have [checked your balance for the bank account](https://help.tallysolutions.com/get-balance/ "https://help.tallysolutions.com/get-balance/"), then the most recently fetched bank balance appears at the top of the report.

[![](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/2-e-payments-summary-config.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/2-e-payments-summary-config.jpg)

#### [Switch Bank Ledgers from Within the Report](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/\#switch-bank-ledgers)

You can change the Bank Ledger for which you want to view the report.

1. Press **F4** (Bank Ledger).
2. Select the ledger and press **Enter**.

[![View e-Payments Report for Bank Ledger](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/3-select-bank-ledger-to-view-e-payments-report-tallyprime.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/3-select-bank-ledger-to-view-e-payments-report-tallyprime.jpg)

The report gets displayed for the selected ledger.

[![e-Payments Summary Report for a Different Bank Ledger](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/4-e-payments-report-after-changing-bank-ledger-tallyprime.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/4-e-payments-report-after-changing-bank-ledger-tallyprime.jpg)

#### [View the report with transactions recorded for a party](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/\#change-party-ledger)

When you drill down from a specific section in the e-Payments report, you get to view the report with transactions created for all the parties. You can further view the report for a specific party.

1. Press **Ctrl+F4** (Ledger).

[![View e-Payments for Party Ledger](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/5-select-party-ledger-to-view-e-payments-report-tallyprime.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/5-select-party-ledger-to-view-e-payments-report-tallyprime.jpg)
2. Select the ledger and press **Enter**.

[![e-Payments Report for Specific Ledger](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/6-e-payments-for-selected-ledger-tallyprime.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/6-e-payments-for-selected-ledger-tallyprime.jpg)

The report gets displayed with the transactions recorded for the party.

#### [View the report with transactions of a specific payment types](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/\#specific-payment-types)

When you drill down from a specific section of the report, you can also filter the report to view transactions with a specific payment type. Additionally, you can include the transactions with exact match available in Bank Reconciliation.

1. Press **Ctrl+B** (Basis of Value).

[![Basis of Values - e-Payments Report](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/7-basis-of-values-e-payments-report.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/7-basis-of-values-e-payments-report.jpg)
2. Select the Payment Type.

1. Press **Enter** on Payment Type.
2. Select the option, based on the type of payment, such as Payroll or all payments excluding Payroll.
3. **Include Transactions with Exact Match Available in Bank Reconciliation**: **Yes**.

The report displays the transactions that have an exact match in the Bank Reconciliation report.
4. **Include Payments with Transfer Mode**: When you drill down from a section, you can choose to view transactions with a specific transfer mode.

## [View Transactions Pending for Sending to Bank](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/\#pending-for-sending)

This section contains transactions that are either ready to be sent to the bank or require action. You can configure this report to view the required information. Moreover, the same configurations are available when you drill down from Incomplete/Incorrect Bank Ledger Master Details, Incomplete/Incorrect Transaction Details, Mismatch in Bank Details (With Masters), and Ready for Sending to Bank.

Press **F12** (Configure) and enable options, based on the information you want to view. For example, you can view the report with the Instrument No. and Date by enabling Show Instrument No. and Show Instrument Date respectively.

[![Configuration for Pending to Send to Bank](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/1-pending-to-send-confic.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/1-pending-to-send-confic.jpg)

### [Ready for Sending to Bank](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/\#ready-to-send "https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-tally/\#ready-to-send")

This section contains transactions with all the information required by the bank.

You can send payments to your suppliers by exporting the payment file and uploading on the respective bank portal.

1. In the **e-Payments** report, drill down from **Ready for Sending to Bank**.
2. Press **Alt+Z** (Exchange) > **Send Payments**.

To know more, refer to [Export/Upload Payment Instructions to the Bank](https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/e-payments-tally/#exportupload-payment-instructions-to-the-bank "https://help.tallysolutions.com/tally-prime/banking-utilities/e-payments-tally/#exportupload-payment-instructions-to-the-bank").

### [Incomplete/Incorrect Bank Ledger Master Details](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/\#incomplete-bank-ledger-details "https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-tally/\#incomplete-bank-ledger-details")

When you do not have the required bank details such as Account No. and IFS Code in the bank ledger, the transaction with the ledger appears in this section.

1. In the **e-Payments** report, drill down from **Incomplete/Incorrect Bank Ledger Master Details.**
2. Select the row and press **Enter**.

The **Bank A/c details** screen appears.

[![Bank A/c Details - Incomplete/Incorrect Bank Ledger Master Details](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/9-resolving-incorrect-incomplete-bank-details-tallyprime.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/9-resolving-incorrect-incomplete-bank-details-tallyprime.jpg)
3. Enter the correct **Account No.**, **IFS Code**, **SWIFT Code**, and any other missing information.
4. Press **Ctrl+A** to save the details.

The transaction moves to the [**Ready for Sending to Bank**](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/#ready-to-send "https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-tally/#ready-to-send") section.

### [Incomplete/Incorrect Transaction Details](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/\#incomplete-transaction-details "https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-tally/\#incomplete-transaction-details")

This section contains transactions with missing or incorrect party’s bank details such as Account No. or IFS Code.

1. In the **e-Payments** report, drill down from **Incomplete/Incorrect Transaction Details**.
2. Select a transaction and press **Enter**.
3. Enter the correct **Account No.**/ **IFS Code** or both, as applicable.

Alternatively, press **Alt+S** (Copy Master Info.) to copy the details from the master to the transaction, if the details are available in the ledger.

If your bank is in UAE, then you need to enter the IBAN No.

4. Press **Ctrl+A** to save the details.

While saving the details, you can do one of the following:

- Press **A** to accept the transaction with the information you entered.
- Press **R** to replace the bank details in the master with the details specified in the voucher.

The **R: Replace** button appears if bank details have been specified in the master.
- Press **D** to accept the transaction and also update your ledger.

This option will not appear while you are copying the details from the master.

The transaction moves to the [**Ready for Sending to Bank**](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/#ready-to-send "https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-tally/#ready-to-send") section.

### [Mismatch in Bank Details (With Masters)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/\#mismatch-bank-details "https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-tally/\#mismatch-bank-details")

If the bank details in the transaction does not match with that specified in the ledger, then the transaction appears in this section.

1. In the **e-Payments** report, drill down from **Mismatch in Bank Details (With Masters)**.
2. Select a transaction and press **Enter**.
3. Press **Alt+S** (Copy Master Info.) to copy the details from the master to the transaction.

[![Resolving Mismatch in Bank Details (With Masters)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/11-mismatch-in-bank-details.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/11-mismatch-in-bank-details.jpg)

If you do not want to make changes in the transaction and accept it as is, then press **Alt+J** (Access As Is).
4. Press **Ctrl+A** to save the details.

The transaction moves to the [**Ready for Sending to Bank**](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/#ready-to-send "https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-tally/#ready-to-send") section.

## [Sent to Bank (Unreconciled)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/\#sent-to-bank "https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-tally/\#sent-to-bank")

This section contains the transactions for which you have exported the payment instructions from TallyPrime or sent payments directly from TallyPrime, if supported in TallyPrime. However, these payments are not yet reconciled.

The sub-sections are categorized based on the status of the e-Payment – In Progress, Unsuccessful, and Successful.

[![Sent to Bank (Unreconciled)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/12-sent-to-bank-unreconciled.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/12-sent-to-bank-unreconciled.jpg)

You can configure the report to view the details, as needed. Moreover, you can also configure the report after drilling down from In Progress, Unsuccessful, and Successful.

Press **F12** (Configure) and enable options, based on the information you want to view. For example, you can view the report with the Instrument No. and Date by enabling Show Instrument No. and Show Instrument Date respectively.

[![Sent to Bank (Unreconciled) - Configurations](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/2-sent-to-bank-config.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/2-sent-to-bank-config.jpg)

### [In Progress](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/\#in-progress "https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-tally/\#in-progress")

The transactions in this section are either exported from TallyPrime or directly sent from TallyPrime to the bank. However, these payments are currently in in progress state as per the latest update. For the exported transactions, the status can be updated by importing a reverse file. For transactions that are sent directly from TallyPrime, you can get the status directly from TallyPrime.

### [Unsuccessful](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/\#transactions-unsuccessful "https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-tally/\#transactions-unsuccessful")

These transactions are exported from TallyPrime and uploaded on the bank portal. However, based on the latest status, the transaction has failed.

### [Successful](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/\#transactions-successful "https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-tally/\#transactions-successful")

These are transactions which which were processed successfully.

If you are using TallyPrime Release 5.1 or earlier versions, then click here

## [e-Payments Report](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/\#report-prev-rel)

The e-Payments report in TallyPrime provide you with a clear picture of all your e-payment transactions. You can view and track the status of your e-payment transactions, and identify any incomplete information or mismatch in beneficiary details. You can view the e-payments that are sent (or ready to be sent) to the bank. You can also view the bank balance as per the company’s books and compare it with the balance as per the bank.

In the case of DBS (India), you can open the bank portal directly from the e-Payments report.

_In this section_

- [View e-Payments Report](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/#view-e-payments-report)
- [Transactions recorded with incomplete bank details](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/#transactions-incomplete-bank-details)
- [Transactions with Mismatch in Bank Details (with Master)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/#transactions-mismatch-bank-details)
- [Transactions Sent to Bank (Unreconciled)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/#transactions-sent-bank)
- [Bank balance as per company books](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/#bank-balance)

### [View e-Payments Report](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/\#view-e-payments-report)

The default view of the e-Payment report displays the list of errors for which the payment instruction is not generated along with the count of transactions and the amount. If you have transactions in multiple bank ledgers then all the bank ledgers are shown in multiple columns together with the transaction count and amount. Apart from the error list, you can also see the list of transactions that were sent to the bank but it is not yet reconciled and also the list of transactions that are ready to be sent to the bank.

[![](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/watch-video.png)](https://youtu.be/Lifa8Mv-lrc)

- Press **A** **lt+G** (Go To) > type or select **e-Payments** \> press **Enter**.

Alternatively, **Gateway of Tally** > **Banking** > **e-Payments** \> press **Enter**.

[![e-Payment report](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/e-Paymentreport.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/e-Paymentreport.jpg)

The transactions displayed in the report include vendor payments or payroll payments, or both, according to your business type. You can include or exclude the payroll transactions by pressing **F8**(Exclude Payroll).

If you have already sent the list of transactions to the bank, then you can include exported or processed transactions by pressing **Ctrl+B** (Basis of Values) > enable **Include Exported/Processed transactions**.

### [Transactions recorded with incomplete bank details](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/\#transactions-incomplete-bank-details)

The **Transactions with Incomplete Bank Details** section displays transactions in which certain mandatory bank details (such as A/c No. and IFS Code) were not specified for e-Fund Transfer. You can select the transaction and provide the required information and then the transactions will be ready to be sent to the bank. You can also choose to add the same details to the party master.

[![](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/watch-video.png)](https://youtu.be/Bw4mG6mhkgI)

1. Press **A** **lt+G** (Go To) > type or select **e-Payments** \> press **Enter**.

Alternatively, **Gateway of Tally** > **Banking** > **e-Payments** \> press **Enter**.
2. Drill down from the required bank column for the **Transactions with Incomplete Bank Details** section, as shown below:

[![Transaction with incomplete bank details](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Transaction-with-incomplete-bank-details.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Transaction-with-incomplete-bank-details.jpg)
3. Press **Alt+H** (Exclude) to exclude the transaction or press **Enter** to view the **Bank Details** screen.

[![Bank allocation](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bank-allocation.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bank-allocation.jpg)
4. Provide the missing information, or press **Alt+S** (Copy Master Info.) to copy the bank details from the master to the voucher.

While saving the details, you can do one of the following:

- Press **A** to accept the transaction with the information you entered.
- Press **R** to replace the master details with the bank details specified in the voucher. The **R: Replace** button appears if bank details have been specified in the master.
- Press **D** to accept the transaction and also update your master ledger. This option will not appear while you are copying the details from the master.
- Press **B** to make any changes in the **Bank Details (Voucher)** section.

Once the details are updated the transaction moves to the **Ready for sending to bank** section.

### [Transactions with Mismatch in Bank Details (with Masters)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/\#transactions-mismatch-bank-details)

When the bank details specified in a transaction do not match with the bank details specified in the party master, the transaction will be listed under **Transactions with Mismatch in Bank Details (with Masters)** in the **e-Payments** report. You can copy the information from the master to the voucher directly from the **e-Payments** report. You can accept the details in the master or press **Alt+J** (Accept as is) to accept the modified bank details.

[![](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/watch-video.png)](https://youtu.be/V7_yKhjzKBk)

1. Press **A** **lt+G** (Go To) > type or select **e-Payments** \> press **Enter**.

Alternatively, **Gateway of Tally** > **Banking** > **e-Payments** \> press **Enter**.
2. Drill down from the required bank column for the **Transactions with Mismatch in Bank Details (with Masters)** section. The following screen appears:

[![Transaction with information mismatch](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Transaction-with-information-mismatch.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Transaction-with-information-mismatch.jpg)
3. Press **Alt+H** (Exclude) to exclude the transaction, press **Alt+J** (Accept as is) or press **Enter** to view the **Bank Details** screen.

[![Bank allocation for information mismath](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bank-allocation-for-information-mismath.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bank-allocation-for-information-mismath.jpg)
4. Press **Alt+S** (Copy Master Info.) to copy the bank details from the master to the voucher.
5. Press **Enter** to accept the bank details as per the master. This will ensure that the bank details are the same as the bank details entered in the bank ledger master.

Once completed, the selected transaction moves to the **Ready for sending to bank** section.

### [Transactions Sent to Bank (Unreconciled)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/\#transactions-sent-bank)

The e-Payments report also displays transactions that have been already sent to the bank, but are yet to be reconciled, under the **Transactions Sent to Bank (Unreconciled)** section. You can check the status of the transactions and import the intermediate/reverse file to update the status. In the case of DBS, press **Alt+R** (Update Status) to refresh the status.

[![](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/watch-video.png)](https://youtu.be/XrqESECjW8Y)

1. Press **A** **lt+G** (Go To) > type or select **e-Payments** \> press **Enter**.

Alternatively, **Gateway of Tally** > **Banking** > **e-Payments** \> press **Enter**.
2. Drill down from the required bank column for the **Transactions Sent to Bank (Unreconciled)** section.
3. Press **Enter**. The **e-Payments** screen for the bank appears with the status of each of the transactions, as shown below:

[![transactions sent to bank](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/transactions-sent-to-bank.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/transactions-sent-to-bank.jpg)
4. Press **F5** (Refresh) to view the updated status of the transactions.

**[Re-export transactions to bank \| Reset Status](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/#reset-status)**

The **Transactions Sent to Bank (Unreconciled)** section also provides you with the option to reset the status of your exported transactions and reconsider them for e-payments. For instance, you might have exported the transaction already, but the file is lost or damaged. In such cases, you can reset the status of the transaction and re-export it to the bank portal. You only have to select the transaction and press **Alt+S** (Reset Status). The transaction will be reconsidered for e-payments and included in the relevant section.

For DBS transactions, one of the following statuses may appear:

- **Submitted** – When transactions are sent to the bank.
- **Verifying** – When transactions are under verification by the bank.
- **Authorisation pending** – When transactions have been accepted by the bank and are available for authorisation on the bank portal.
- **Authorised** – When transactions are authorised on the bank portal.
- **Processed** – When transactions are processed by the bank.
- **Failed** – When transactions have failed due to incorrect sender A/c no., invalid IFS code, unregistered TSS ID with the bank, and so on.

### [Bank Balance as per Company Books](https://help.tallysolutions.com/e-payments-report/\#bank-balance)

In the e-Payments report, the **Bank Balance as per Company Books** section reflects the balance as of the last date.

[![](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/watch-video.png)](https://youtu.be/D5Sfy_Y5mNs)

- Press **A** **lt+G** (Go To) > type or select **e-Payments** \> press **Enter**.

Alternatively, **Gateway of Tally** > **Banking** > **e-Payments** \> press **Enter**.
- Drill down from **Bank Balance as per Company Books** to view all your unreconciled vouchers in one place.

[![Bank Balance ](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bank-Balance-.jpg)](https://help.tallysolutions.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bank-Balance-.jpg)

You can view the transactions that were excluded from the e-payment process, by pressing **Alt+H** (Show Included). If you want to include the transaction in the e-payment process, then select the transaction and press **Alt+S** (Reset Status). The transaction will be considered for e-payments and included in the relevant section.
